result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael P Mayberry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Dodge Correctional as reception center.  Counsel stipulate to 1 day credit for time served.
Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael P Mayberry

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Wisconsin Correctional Center System for copy of amended JOC dated 10/18/2016 - 2nd Request; Mailed copy to address listed on request and noted on request that the 1st request copy was mailed 11-30-16 to same address
from Wisconsin Correctional Center System for copy of amended JOC dated 10/18/2016; mailed copy
of Conviction and Order - ERP
Sentencing Hearing held this 18th  day of December 2015
letters in support of the defendant, offered by defense counsel to the Court at the time of sentencing
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Michael P Mayberry in court with attorney Gerald C. Opgenorth. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing for OWI 6th.  Counsel and def address the Court prior to sentencing.

Sentence:  3 years WI prison system with 18 mo in and 18 out.  $600 plus costs.  36 mo revocation.  36 mo IID.  AODA/driver safety plan to be relicensed.  Defense has requested a stay of the prison start.  DA objects.  Court denies the stay.  Def remanded to the custody of the sheriff.

ERP eligible.  

Credit:  Counsel stipulate to 1 day.
(filed electronically by DOC, 2 days after paper copy was filed - clerk believes these to be the same document just duplicative)

Prior: 28834 Herdor Cir, Lone Rock, WI 53556
Sentencing hearing at 12-18-2015 02:30 pm

Clerk's scheduling conference, by phone with Atty. Opgenorth and the DA's office, not on the record.  This case was set for sentencing today but needs to be reset to allow time for the PSI to come in.  Due to a glitch, the PSI order did not go out in August when it was originally ordered.  PSI order to go out now and sentencing is reset to 12/18/15 at 2:30.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Per Stipulation and Order of 9/3/15, Defendant's bond amended to delete the morning PBT testing requirement.  All other conditions of bond remain the same.
"Bail Bond amended to delete the morning PBT testing requirement ordered to be done by the Sheriff's Department."  cc by clerk electronically to RCSD dispatch, DA, and Atty. Opgenorth
Sentencing hearing at 10-22-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Michael P Mayberry in court with attorney Gerald C. Opgenorth. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Information filed. Defense waives formal reading. Court informs def of the charges brought forth and max possible penalties. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights presented. Colloquy. Plea of no contest entered. Finding of guilty. Court orders PSI from DOC. Sentencing requested and set.
Arraignment at 08-24-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Michael P Mayberry in court with attorney Gerald C. Opgenorth. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Prelim waived.  Court's colloquy re waiver.  Arraignment set.  Arraignment scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 08-07-2015 01:30 pm

11:04 a.m.  Defendant Michael P Mayberry not in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gerald C. Opgenorth in court for Defendant Michael P Mayberry.  DA - def supposed to be here; asks for warrant that's stayed til Friday, 8/7; counsel could appear by phone for that.  Court authorizes warrant - stays it til 8/7 at 1:30.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 08-05-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Michael P Mayberry in court with attorney Gerald C. Opgenorth. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court states the charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his rights including right to prelim.  Prelim time limits waived and prelim set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.
